definition: will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now
a moment ago/just now/(indicating sth happening later than expected)/(preceded by a clause of condition or reason) not until/(followed by a numerical clause) only

sentences.english: The abilities of a soldier are never known until they have been blooded.
sentences.chinese: 只有经历过战火，才知道一个士兵是否是将才。

sentences.english: I quite agree with everything he said just now.
I had an odd sense of deja vu just as you said that.
sentences.chinese: 你将才提到的事，我有一中似曾相似的奇怪幻觉。

sentences.english: I'd really hate to lose him.
He said the bank would close soon and would not open again until Monday.
sentences.chinese: 他说银行很快就要关门，直到礼拜一将才会开门。

definition: to lead military operations with extraordinary skill
well versed in letters and military technology (idiom); fine scholar and soldier/master of pen and sword
fierce general/valiant military leader/fig. brave individual
outstanding talent/wise and able person/illustrious individual
expert at appointing people according to their abilities (idiom)/to put the right people in the right places
